channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14596] TestCellACLs failing... on1.2 builds
item.description:
Caught this in 1.7 builds:

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: It fails regularly with the 1.8 and 1.7 builds... here for instance: https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.2/jdk=latest1.7,label=Hadoop/242/consoleText
Looks like a RPC deadlock. Up the number of handlers?

I pushed this 'tune-up'. Closes all connections and tables when done. Ups priortity handler count because seems like could be case for the above hang on shutdown in one of the 1.7 tests. Added timeouts. Lets see how it does. Leaving issue open.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6901 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6901/)
HBASE-14596 TestCellACLs failing... on1.2 builds; TUNEUP (stack: rev 2428c5f46712ac026f2523bd12ad9ea88359fca6)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestCellACLs.java

Added some debug

I saw this in 1.2 recent run: https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.2/jdk=latest1.7,label=Hadoop/247/consoleText

It manifests as this:


Failed tests: 

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLs.testCellPermissions(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLs)

  Run 1: TestCellACLs.testCellPermissions:230->SecureTestUtil.verifyIfNull:237 Non null results from action for user 'other'

  Run 2: TestCellACLs.testCellPermissions:230->SecureTestUtil.verifyIfNull:237 Non null results from action for user 'other'

  Run 3: TestCellACLs.testCellPermissions:230->SecureTestUtil.verifyIfNull:237 Non null results from action for user 'other'
For that latter failure, someone has broken code the test is checking (or the test). Let me bisect and see if I can find it.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-1.3-IT #232 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3-IT/232/)
HBASE-14596 TestCellACLs failing... on1.2 builds; TUNEUP – ADD DEBUG (stack: rev 50866daab3af4b2680a2566200acc8dcad23b3b0)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/SecureTestUtil.java

Andrew Purtell Why does it not fail locally? (if it did, I'd bisect myself).

If you look, you'll see that we are getting two columns. The first does the right thing... comes back null.. but the other returns something... when it should not though it should act as the just previous. Bit baffled myself.
Looks like I'll need to pick your tuneup at each step when bisecting stack.
It is failing locally, but only after the tuneup, otherwise it hangs. Been broken on this branch for a while.
Sorry Andrew Purtell... yes, it is reproducible locally. It is passing in trunk but not in branch-1.2. I missed that. You bisecting still? Else I will...
Yes I'm looking at it now

diff --git a/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestCellACLs.java b/hbase-server/src/tes

index 393bb36..2a27a13 100644

@@ -31,6 +31,7 @@ import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Cell;

 import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Coprocessor;

+import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HConstants;

 import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableNotFoundException;

@@ -99,6 +100,7 @@ public class TestCellACLs extends SecureTestUtil {

   public static void setupBeforeClass() throws Exception {

     // setup configuration

     conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();

+    conf.setInt(HConstants.REGION_SERVER_HIGH_PRIORITY_HANDLER_COUNT, 10);

     // Enable security

     enableSecurity(conf);

     // Verify enableSecurity sets up what we require

then the test passes on branch-1.2. I backed out the 'tune up' changes and applied just this change.

If I apply the tuneup patch to branch-1.1, TestCellACLs fails there too.

Let me try making the connection reuse / getTable changes in addition to the setup configuration change without any of the other minor changes.

Oh, of course. You can't reuse the connection stack because some tests want to connect with different Users. That cached connection will always present system user credentials. Just make the change that ups the number of priority handlers and we should be good. Sorry for being a bit slow today.
